projects.title: Beyond Rivers End | A Ugandan Rowers Journey - Amsterdam, NL
projects.description:
Gerald Gamreal Ssemambo, a 20 yr old male single sculler from Kampala, Uganda, has been invited to compete at the 2013 World Rowing Cup, Under 23 Rowing Championships, World Championships in Korea, and the prestigious Holland-Beker Regatta in June. Elite rowing environments, at least from a european standard, do not exist in Uganda. Fortunately, his transportation to these events has been covered by FISA, the World Rowing Organization.

Unfortunately, the elite coaching, methodology and equipment to be competitive on a world stage is something he severely lacks. Basics such as proper nutrition and clothing are also a challenge. This is where we need your help.

Olympic Solidarity, is defined as the  “aim is to organize assistance for all the National Olympic Committees (NOC), particularly those with the greatest needs, so that they can develop their own structures to favor the expansion of sport in their country,” are noble. It's Bigger Than You feels this is a noble cause.

Our commitment, though, is to ensure that athletes, especially those from NOC's with fledgling rowing federations, have the proper tools they need to be physically, psychologically and emotionally ready for these types of racing environments. Gerald's success inspires future Ugandan athletes to row, and develops Uganda's Rowing Programs for future generations. 

Hamadou Djibo Issaka of Niger, who was invited to race in the men's single sculls in the 2012 Olympics, was quoted in a recent article :“When asked about finishing so far behind in his races, the quietly spoken Issaka replied that he was “used to it” and didn't mind…”

The invitation of all athletes should be accompanied with a true commitment to the athlete as well.

profile_positions.description:
I am chairman of a non-profit organization that creates awareness about the importance of inclusive sport; social inclusion through team sport, and the promotion of people, initiatives, events, partnerships and organizations that want to do the same. 

I build sustainable programming for various challenged target groups, invest in outreach and education regarding the possibilities of rowing for the challenged, and raise funds by building unique team building and corporate rowing day events for corporations.
